meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Families often memorialise their loved ones by keeping photographs and mementos.
meanings.sent2: The community decided to memorialise the fallen soldiers with a statue in the town square.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, they jokingly decided to memorialise Uncle Bob's burnt cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The old journal memorialises the adventures of a young explorer in vivid detail.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins memorialise a civilization long forgotten.

meanings.definition: To commemorate or honor someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The school will memorialise the retiring principal with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: Every year, we memorialise the veterans who bravely served our country.
meanings.sent3: The town decided to memorialise the famous actor by naming a street after him.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork beautifully memorialises the beauty of nature in every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The monument was built to memorialise the historic battle that took place on this land.

meanings.definition: To create a memorial or tribute.
meanings.sent1: The artist plans to memorialise the tragic event through a powerful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to memorialise the victims of the natural disaster.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising move, they decided to memorialise the old tree by planting a new one.
meanings.sent4: The song beautifully memorialises the love story of the couple who met at the park.
meanings.sent5: The painting will memorialise the historical event for generations to come.
